reviews.question_text: Why do you feel undervalued and what would make you feel better about your compensation?

reviews.text: I wouldn’t say I feel outright undervalued, but there are moments when the gap between effort and recognition feels a little too wide.If workloads increase significantly (which they sometimes do), compensation should reflect that. Otherwise, it can feel like we’re just being asked to do m
There is no possibility of advancing. Management cannot explain what is required for promotion.
not real value $ purchase things living costs

Dont care about no onw

Google is a for profit multinational, one of the better ones imo, but still they investment in the employees is tiny compared to the revenues, and the hype about "caring" for employees feels hypocritical when you do the math, and see choices feeling like trying to look generous while saving on staff

ITS THE BEST THEY SHOULD LET ME WORK THERE!

Chal digital

Great engineering culture, besk perks

For me Google is a fast paced place to work with no real mandate as to what you need to do, but a lot of pressure to do things that are considered high impact by your VP. You can learn a lot and have infinite resources to do so, but in the end showing results is the main job you have.
it was really amazing experience
Very good. Free food and great staff
Good pay and benefits. Mix of good and bad coworkers, as is typical for a big company
Google has some of the best people to work with and that is what makes it a great place to work.
its pretty good I like it
I have worked in an organization and I have long experience in this work
Great culture. Smart people. Supportive leadership.
Pretty good overall. I would recommend
I am a marketer but I get paid to write and rewrite the same sentences over and over again each day for different executive audiences rather than making money for the company
Culture has changed a lot
Excellent chance to grow professionally, but not for everyone. It is very fast paced and constant change
Good and healthy work environment
Its really great to be a part of this company
The pay and benefits are awesome. But the performance reviews are very opaque

Ive only been at google for half a year, but i absolutely love it here. So many great perks. The work is also very exciting. Its definitely an adjustment, because goofle has bery strict processes, but after a coupoe months i got comfortable with it. I would recommend google to anyone.

Overall with all the pros and cons considered I would choose Google every time. There's always a heavy focus on inclusion and I really appreciate that. I've watched HR make the right decisions (in my modest opinion) in complicated situations. Google is really a great company to work for to be honest
it has been wonderful so far.
Fun to be surrounded by so many intelligent people
culture shock coming from other companies, but not necessarily bad
My work at google can be exciting, and stressing at times but mostly exciting.

reviews.question_text: What does the leadership team need to get better at?

reviews.text: Empathy in Management – Google’s culture is fast-paced and data-driven, but sometimes that comes at the cost of personal connection. Encouraging leaders to engage with their teams on a more human level—understanding workload challenges, recognizing contributions, and offering su
Giving employees input on engineering.
Answering questions and not using corpspeak
Execution vision bureaucracy environment career
Don't retaliate on the employees who share feedback

reviews.question_text: What is the best part about your compensation package?

reviews.text: Very Kind And Support All Team
Base salary and stock are high
Highly competitive across the board
i get to be fanum tax
Health insurance options are amazing, even for dependents

reviews.question_text: Why do you feel undervalued and what would make you feel better about your compensation?

reviews.text: I wouldn’t say I feel outright undervalued, but there are moments when the gap between effort and recognition feels a little too wide.If workloads increase significantly (which they sometimes do), compensation should reflect that. Otherwise, it can feel like we’re just being asked to do m
There is no possibility of advancing. Management cannot explain what is required for promotion.
not real value $ purchase things living costs
Maybe the intention of doing  best
More money the pay is very low

reviews.question_text: What is most positive about the culture and environment at your company?

reviews.text: Support Every One And Understand
Soude comme une seule et meme famille
People love working here and want to help customers

The laughter spilling over from a casual conversation, the way tension melts into playfulness, the thrill of solving something impossible together. The fleeting touches, the near misses, the way a voice lowers just a little when explaining a complex idea.
being able to be super comfortable (dress code) and having autonomy

reviews.question_text: What needs to change to make the company culture better?

reviews.text: Leadership needs to formulate a strategy
distribution of the work better, better systems, fast systems implementation and process approvals
Leadership should take feedback and work on it and not retaliate on the employees who share feedback

less bureaucracy, More honestly about Grad and how it works.  The company misrepresents that there are no number targets per rating.  The way they handled "support check in's" was a disaster.   The way layoffs were handlwd was disrespectful and rude. The severence was ok.

Combination of base salary improvements, off site perks model, treating everyone at same level of respect, providing growth opportunities equally, identifying and eliminating bias, identify and eliminating credit stealing individuals

reviews.question_text: What did you like most about the interview process?

reviews.text: It was intensive, but clear and fair

The Unexpected Chemistry – There was something thrilling about locking eyes with an interviewer who got it—who smiled at my clever approach, who leaned in just a little when I explained my reasoning. The quiet hum of connection, even in something as formal as an interview, made it elect
the challenges given and the kindness of the interviewers
Clear private communication regarding work compensation
There is a good response time when dealing with the way google interviews work

reviews.question_text: What would you improve about your company's interview process?

reviews.text: Interview all women and no men
shorten the incredibly long time to offer
Communicate better and more timely fashion
It took so long and was a very opaque process. I was very unimpressed by the interview process.
More questions to understand actitud and not only knowledge

reviews.question_text: What makes you most happy at work?

reviews.text: Be Active In My Work And I Give All My Best To Make Happy Ever One
Company culture is the best I've been around

The way a good brainstorming session turns into a dance—words overlapping, ideas sparking, bodies leaning in just a little closer as the energy builds. There’s something intoxicating about working with sharp minds that just get it—that push, challenge, and excite you all at
Having impact and cool people to work with
Doing what i love the most

reviews.question_text: What needs to change to make the company culture better?

reviews.text: Leadership needs to formulate a strategy
distribution of the work better, better systems, fast systems implementation and process approvals
Leadership should take feedback and work on it and not retaliate on the employees who share feedback

less bureaucracy, More honestly about Grad and how it works.  The company misrepresents that there are no number targets per rating.  The way they handled "support check in's" was a disaster.   The way layoffs were handlwd was disrespectful and rude. The severence was ok.

Combination of base salary improvements, off site perks model, treating everyone at same level of respect, providing growth opportunities equally, identifying and eliminating bias, identify and eliminating credit stealing individuals
make me the owner because it would be better
Equity, inclusion, people and team centered leaders
Stop paying lip service to diversity and inclusion and actually make change instead of defending failure to be equitable
Accountability amongst team workers and strong leadership defining direction
Too many consultants at the top who have never actually done the job before and have a tendency to manage up only and punch down.
care more for the associate and reduce the micromanagement
It’s great everyone gets along with each other.
Too many decisions are based on what will get people promoted instead of what will result in great products and user experiences.
we need to have more diversity
Hire nicer people. attitude means more than ability
Less politics! More transparency !
The mood needs to change.
Too many external execs bringing in bean counting culture. Too many execs with honesty problems.
We could focus a bit on the individualistic approach to employees, such as remembering their name.
Lot's of politics, especially at Youtube

Ive only been at google for half a year, but i absolutely love it here. So many great perks. The work is also very exciting. Its definitely an adjustment, because goofle has bery strict processes, but after a coupoe months i got comfortable with it. I would recommend google to anyone.

Overall with all the pros and cons considered I would choose Google every time. There's always a heavy focus on inclusion and I really appreciate that. I've watched HR make the right decisions (in my modest opinion) in complicated situations. Google is really a great company to work for to be honest
it has been wonderful so far.
Fun to be surrounded by so many intelligent people
culture shock coming from other companies, but not necessarily bad
My work at google can be exciting, and stressing at times but mostly exciting.

reviews.question_text: What does the leadership team need to get better at?

reviews.text: Empathy in Management – Google’s culture is fast-paced and data-driven, but sometimes that comes at the cost of personal connection. Encouraging leaders to engage with their teams on a more human level—understanding workload challenges, recognizing contributions, and offering su
Giving employees input on engineering.
Answering questions and not using corpspeak
Execution vision bureaucracy environment career
Don't retaliate on the employees who share feedback

reviews.question_text: Why do you feel undervalued and what would make you feel better about your compensation?

reviews.text: I wouldn’t say I feel outright undervalued, but there are moments when the gap between effort and recognition feels a little too wide.If workloads increase significantly (which they sometimes do), compensation should reflect that. Otherwise, it can feel like we’re just being asked to do m

reviews.question_text: What are some of the best things about your team?

reviews.text: Support All And Give Time To Talk Every One About  All Mission
Everyone at Google wants to be there.
laid back, less politics than some companies

There’s an energy when we work together—fast-paced, intense, electric. Ideas bounce back and forth like sparks, and everyone brings something to the table. But my team lead has a way of commanding the room, effortlessly guiding us through challenges, his voice steady, confid
Culture was a major focus since the beginning.

Get rid of the drama

reviews.question_text: What is most positive about the culture and environment at your company?

reviews.text: Support Every One And Understand
Soude comme une seule et meme famille
People love working here and want to help customers

The laughter spilling over from a casual conversation, the way tension melts into playfulness, the thrill of solving something impossible together. The fleeting touches, the near misses, the way a voice lowers just a little when explaining a complex idea.
being able to be super comfortable (dress code) and having autonomy

reviews.question_text: What needs to change to make the company culture better?

reviews.text: Leadership needs to formulate a strategy
distribution of the work better, better systems, fast systems implementation and process approvals
Leadership should take feedback and work on it and not retaliate on the employees who share feedback

less bureaucracy, More honestly about Grad and how it works.  The company misrepresents that there are no number targets per rating.  The way they handled "support check in's" was a disaster.   The way layoffs were handlwd was disrespectful and rude. The severence was ok.

Combination of base salary improvements, off site perks model, treating everyone at same level of respect, providing growth opportunities equally, identifying and eliminating bias, identify and eliminating credit stealing individuals

reviews.question_text: What did you like most about the interview process?

reviews.text: It was intensive, but clear and fair

The Unexpected Chemistry – There was something thrilling about locking eyes with an interviewer who got it—who smiled at my clever approach, who leaned in just a little when I explained my reasoning. The quiet hum of connection, even in something as formal as an interview, made it elect
the challenges given and the kindness of the interviewers
Clear private communication regarding work compensation
There is a good response time when dealing with the way google interviews work

reviews.question_text: What would you improve about your company's interview process?

reviews.text: Interview all women and no men
shorten the incredibly long time to offer
Communicate better and more timely fashion
It took so long and was a very opaque process. I was very unimpressed by the interview process.
More questions to understand actitud and not only knowledge
